lead_paragraph: PRINCE LOUIS NAPOLEON'S penchant for governing implies a decided fitness for the office of thief-taker. His administration has had far more of the business of a Minister of Police, than of the noble vocations of President or General-in-Chief; his qualities better suit the mask and mantle of Vidocq than the military surtout of the Emperor.
